intro: Allionia chersophila, commonly known as the sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with narrow, gray-green leaves that help reduce water loss. Allionia chersophila is often found in coastal dunes and is adapted to withstand strong winds and salt spray.
